content:
That's awesome! "Hamilton" is an incredible musical, and it's no surprise it got you back into the musical spirit! Lin-Manuel Miranda's masterpiece is a game-changer, and its impact on the musical theater world is undeniable.

"Sing Street" and "The Greatest Showman" are both fantastic choices to follow up your "Hamilton" re-watch. "Sing Street" is a more intimate, indie-style musical with a focus on the music and coming-of-age themes, while "The Greatest Showman" is a bigger, more spectacle-driven musical with a focus on showmanship and spectacle. Both are highly entertaining and feature memorable soundtracks.

If you're still in the mood for more musicals, I can recommend some other titles that might interest you. Have you seen "In the Heights" (2020), another Lin-Manuel Miranda creation? It's a vibrant, energetic musical with a similar blend of hip-hop, Latin music, and heartwarming storytelling.

Or, if you're open to something a bit more classic, you might enjoy "Fiddler on the Roof" (1971) or "West Side Story" (1961), both of which are timeless musical masterpieces with iconic scores and memorable performances.

Let me know if you have any other preferences or specific interests, and I can try to suggest more targeted recommendations!
